headline.print_headline: Clients Raise Questions About MF Global Checks
headline.main: Clients Raise Questions About MF Global Checks

docs.snippet: A group representing MF Global customers is trying to prove that the firm delayed returning its money, using checks rather than wire transfers, in an attempt to stay afloat....
docs.abstract: A group representing MF Global customers is trying to prove that the firm delayed returning its money, using checks rather than wire transfers, in an attempt to stay afloat.

headline.main: A Report for the Web, on TV

docs.snippet: I've always walked around the house naked. So far, my 8- and 12-year-old sons remain unfazed. How long can we keep this up?...

headline.main: Apple's Chief Puts His Stamp on Labor Issues

docs.snippet: When Timothy D. Cook, the chief executive of Apple, appeared at a controversial factory in China where Apple devices are made, Nick Wingfield writes that was an illustration of how differently Mr. Cook relates to an issue that first surfaced under...
docs.abstract: When Timothy D. Cook, the chief executive of Apple, appeared at a controversial factory in China where Apple devices are made, Nick Wingfield writes that was an illustration of how differently Mr. Cook relates to an issue that first surfaced under his predecessor, Steven P. Jobs. Since Mr. Cook became chief executive last autumn, shortly before Mr. Jobs died, Apple has taken some significant steps to address concerns about how Apple products are made.

headline.main: Your Choice for World Bank President?

docs.snippet: The United States has been able to say who will lead the World Bank since its creation in 1944. But the world has changed since then. Is it time for the Bank to change too?...

headline.main: Anticipation High for Rangers-Bruins, but Tortorella Doesn't Let On

docs.snippet: Ahead of Sunday's Rangers-Bruins game at Madison Square Garden, in which the Rangers can clinch the No. 1 seed in the Eastern Conference and home ice through at least the first three rounds of the playoffs, Coach John Tortorella was in extreme bus...
docs.abstract: Ahead of Sunday's Rangers-Bruins game at Madison Square Garden, in which the Rangers can clinch the No. 1 seed in the Eastern Conference and home ice through at least the first three rounds of the playoffs, Coach John Tortorella was in extreme business-only mode.

headline.main: Coast Guard Rescues Sailors Whose Yacht Was Overtaken by Wave

docs.snippet: The United States Coast Guard was sent to rescue the crew of the Geraldton Western Australia, which was hit by an enormous wave 400 miles off the coast of California during the Clipper 11-12 Round the World Yacht Race....
